contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox pageant titleholder |name=Heather French |image=Heather French headshot.png |alt= |caption= |title=Miss Louisville 1999<br>[[Miss Kentucky]] 1999<br>[[Miss America]] 2000 |nationalcompetition=[[Miss America 2000]] (winner) |birth_name=Heather Renee French<ref name="birth date">{{cite news|url=http://search.ancestry.com/search/db.aspx?dbid=8788&enc=1|title=Kentucky Birth Index, 1911-1999|publisher=Ancestry.com|date=|accessdate=December 17, 2010|first=|last=}}</ref> |birth_date={{birth date and age|1974|12|29}}<ref name="birth date"/> |birth_place=[[Maysville, Kentucky|Maysville]], [[Kentucky]], [[United States|U.S.]] |eye_color=Brown |hair_color=Brown |height={{height|ft=5|in=6}}<ref name="pbsbio">{{cite web|title=Miss America 2000|publisher=PBS|url=http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/amex/missamerica/sfeature/pop_2000.html|accessdate=2011-10-06}}</ref> |weight= |measurements= |spouse=[[Steve Henry]] (m. 2000–present) |children=2 }} '''Heather Renee French Henry''' (born December 29, 1974) is an [[United States|American]] [[Miss America]] title holder, [[Celebrity|personality]] and [[fashion designer]]. Raised in [[Maysville, Kentucky|Maysville]], [[Kentucky]], Heather French Henry graduated from the [[University of Cincinnati College of Design, Architecture, Art, and Planning]]. She competed in pageants through her teens, including the Miss Ohio pageant. She competed in the Miss Kentucky Pageant four times before winning the title on her fifth attempt in 1999. She won the 2000 [[Miss America]] pageant in September 1999, the first Kentuckian to do so. Her platform for her reign was raising awareness of [[homeless veterans]]; her father was a wounded veteran of the [[Vietnam War]]. She has received numerous awards for her work with veterans.<ref>[http://www.missamerica.org/our-miss-americas/2000/2000.aspx Miss America--Heather French bio]</ref> On October 27, 2000, she married Kentucky Lieutenant Governor [[Steve Henry]] in [[Louisville, Kentucky|Louisville]], [[Kentucky]].<ref> [http://www.enquirer.com/editions/2000/10/27/loc_ex-miss_america.html Ex-Miss America becomes Mrs. Steve Henry today]</ref> The couple have two daughters, Harper Renee (born 2001) and Taylor Augusta (born 2003).<ref>[http://www.louisvillewedding.com/magazine_2004springsummer_featurewedding.php Details of the French/Henry wedding]</ref> In October 2003, French Henry struck and subsequently killed Karola Stede, 44, a native of Germany and mother of four who was crossing against the traffic light in a Louisville intersection. French said that the accident deeply affected her, and she subsequently recounted her story in venues such as ''[[The Oprah Winfrey Show]]''.<ref>[http://www.enquirer.com/editions/2003/11/15/loc_kyhenryonoprah15.html Heather French Henry relives pain on "Oprah"]</ref> On December 13, 2006, a California book publishing company filed a lawsuit against French Henry, claiming that she did not fulfill her contractual obligations regarding a children's book venture. The lawsuit seeks over $350,000 in damages. Heather French Henry participated in ''[[Don't Forget the Lyrics]]'' episode that aired on December 12, 2008, appearing with [[Susan Powell (entertainer)|Susan Powell]] (Miss America 1981) and [[Kirsten Haglund]] (Miss America 2008). On June 26, 2010, Heather French Henry hosted the [[Miss Virginia]] pageant in [[Roanoke, Virginia|Roanoke]], [[Virginia]]. ==See also== * [[List of famous Louisvillians]] * [[Steve Henry (politician)|Steve Henry]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons|Heather French}} * [http://www.heathersveterans.org Heather French Foundation for Veterans Website] * [http://www.heatherfrenchhenry.com Heather French Henry's Official Website] {{S-start}} {{S-ach}} {{Succession box|before=[[Nicole Johnson (Miss America)|Nicole Johnson]]|title=[[Miss America]]|years=2000|after=[[Angela Baraquio]]}} {{Succession box|before=[[Chera-Lyn Cook]]|title=[[Miss Kentucky]]|years=1999|after=[[Shanna Kari Moore]]}} {{S-end}} {{MissAmericas 2000–2019}} {{Kentucky Pageant Winners}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> |NAME=Henry, French Heather |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION= |DATE OF BIRTH=December 29, 1974 |PLACE OF BIRTH=[[Maysville, Kentucky|Maysville]], [[Kentucky]], [[United States|U.S.]] |DATE OF DEATH= |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Henry, Heather French}} [[Category:1974 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Kentucky beauty pageants]] [[Category:Spouses of Kentucky politicians]] [[Category:Miss America winners]] [[Category:Miss America 2000 delegates]] [[Category:People from Louisville, Kentucky]] [[Category:People from Bracken County, Kentucky]] [[Category:People from Mason County, Kentucky]] [[Category:Miss America Preliminary Swimsuit winners]]
